RepositoryName.description: The name of the repository you want to create in GitHub with AWS CloudFormation stack creation.

RepositoryAccessToken.description: The GitHub user's personal access token for the GitHub repository.

RepositoryDescription.description: A comment or description about the new repository. This description is displayed in GitHub after the repository is created.

IsPrivate.description: Indicates whether the GitHub repository is a public repository. If so, you choose who can see and commit to this repository.

OrganizationName.description: If populated with existing Organization Name, creates a Repository on the Organization Account.

EnableIssues.description: Indicates whether to enable issues for the GitHub repository. You can use GitHub issues to track information and bugs for your repository.

EnableWiki.description: Indicates whether to enable wiki for the GitHub repository. You can use GitHub wiki for hosting documentation for your repository in a wiki, so that others can use and contribute to your project.

EnableDownloads.description: Indicates whether to enable downloads for the GitHub repository. You can use GitHub downloads to publish a package to GitHub Packages to make the package available for others to download and re-use.
